1543656691_1HbvuN84epzW1vjpRjgemxPADB6Uq.body:
> [bitcoder](#comment_8_1HbvuN84epzW1vjpRjgemxPADB6UqdZpvy): I'm using my home internet connection. I have no special firewall rules on it. Unfortunately I can't setup UPnP or port forward on my router right now because I have forgot the admin password. Probably the AV firewall has messed something up here? Please note that I am a Linux user although I'm connecting to ZeroNet from a Windows PC at the moment, so I don't have much knowledge about this crap OS. Thanks for your help. :)

Why are you using an av or an av firewall on linux?

The av software will likely introduce more holes for you to be attacked from and you can use iptables, there is even a gui for it, to control access.
